gw.processes

Class BatchProcessBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.MultiPhaseBatchProcess
      • com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.SinglePhaseBatchProcess
        • gw.processes.BatchProcessBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlagOverdueLegalReportsBatch, PurgeDeletableFiles, PurgeFailedWorkItems, PurgeProcessBase, PurgeWorkflows, WorkItemSetPurge, WorkQueueInstrumentationPurge

    public class BatchProcessBase
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.SinglePhaseBatchProcess
    This class represents a base class for customer written batch processes. Other artifacts that need to be created along with this implementation

    A new BatchProcessType.xml entry for this batch process after making this change be sure to execute ant scheduler-config-xsd

    Your {@link gw.plugin.processing.IProcessesPlugin#createBatchProcess} must have an entry for this.

    Implementation notes:

    You must implement a constructor

    You may want either an argumentless constructor or one that takes an array of objects that can be passed by IMaintenanceAPI

    You must implement doWork.

    This does not yet have a transaction. If you need a transaction (and bundle) use {@link gw.transaction.Transaction#runWithNewBundle}

    This should check TerminateRequested and exit if set

    This should use incrementOperationsCompleted() and incrementOperationsFailed()

    You probably want to implement checkInitialConditions, to set OperationsExpected

    If you accept arguments you may want to override Exclusive, so multiple of this batch process can be run.

    If you are going to ignore TerminateRequested, override terminate() to return false

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setChunkingById(IQueryResult<QT,RT> queryResult, int chunkingSize)
      This will change the result set to do chunking, and the most efficient way of doing this is by Id. Do not sort the results as this will add a sort by id. This has no effect on your code (you still just iterate over the results), but will dramatically improve the performance on large result sets.

      • setProcessHistory

        void setProcessHistory(ProcessHistory processHistory)

        Parameters:

      • setChunkingById

        void setChunkingById(IQueryResult<QT,RT> queryResult,
                   int chunkingSize)
        This will change the result set to do chunking, and the most efficient way of doing this is by Id. Do not sort the results as this will add a sort by id. This has no effect on your code (you still just iterate over the results), but will dramatically improve the performance on large result sets.
        Parameters:
        queryResult - The result of the query
        chunkingSize - the number of rows to return in each chunk.
